author: gqlshare
title: Explore local parks and trails this summer
text:
During the summer months, Rebecca Cook of Phoenixville enjoys most getting her physical activity in later in the day, after work, when temperatures have fallen. While taking in the outdoor surroundings, she also uses it as a time to indulge in a little entertainment.
Rebecca Cook enjoys taking walks at parks during the summer months to get exercise and take in a change of scenery. (Rebecca Cook / For MediaNews Group) â€œI like walking around Reevesâ€™ Park in Phoenixville, usually while listening to podcasts, audiobooks and music,â€ Cook said.
Sometimes sheâ€™ll venture to hiking trails for a change of scenery, such as the Schuylkill River Trail. She more recently visited Ridley Creek State Park.
â€œI did the hiking trail with a friend and loved it,â€ she said. â€œIt was very shady and right along a stream that we could dip our toes in.â€
Ridley Creek State Park is made up of more than 2,606 acres of Delaware County woodlands and meadows. With Ridley Creek running through it, the park is open every day of the year from sunrise to sunset. They have restrooms and picnic areas.
Variety of habitats Located under an hour from Pottstown, the 13 miles of trails at Ridley Creek State Park take you through a variety of habitats. Trails are rated â€œeasiest,â€ for beginner trail users, offering a gentle grade with few obstacles. â€œMore difficultâ€ trails offer a steeper grade and trails that are narrower with embedded rocks on the surface of the trail.
Cook and her friend had a chance to dip their toes in the creek at Ridley Creek State Park. (Rebecca Cook / For MediaNews Group) Their â€œmost difficultâ€ trails are for trail users with advanced skills, offering a steep grade and a physical challenge. â€œMost difficultâ€ routes arenâ€™t as well marked and elevation gain or loss should be expected to be severe.
The Pennsylvania Department of Conservation and Resources highlights eight trails ranging from .34 miles up to 4.7 miles. The â€œMansion Garden Trailâ€ is 1 mile and is in the â€œeasiestâ€ category.
â€œThis paved loop is accessed near the parking lot at the mansion and travels around the historic gardens and mansion area,â€ the Pennsylvania Department of Conservation and Resources states on its website, referring to Hunting Hill Manor, which is a large, English Country Manor.
Great views Walks through neighborhood parks offer a good outlet for physical activity during the summer months. (Pexel / For MediaNews Group) The parkâ€™s Sycamore Mills Road Trail is another in the â€˜easiestâ€™ category that offers some nice scenery to take in.
â€œThis paved, multi-use trail travels through the woods, by the agricultural fields, and next to Ridley Creek,â€ the PDCR states. â€œIt offers great views, easy exercising, and great fishing opportunities.â€
Whether hitting a trail or park, Cook, who works at the Chester Springs Library in Chester County, enjoys spending time outdoors during the summer months for multiple reasons.
â€œI like how green and alive everything is,â€ she said. â€œItâ€™s also a good excuse to sit outside with iced tea and a book.â€
Cook spotted a duck in the creek during her recent visit to Ridley Creek State Park. (Rebecca Cook / For MediaNews Group) Free Community Bike Share Program When Cook was in college, she got most of her physical activity through biking.
â€œI liked biking because it was a more affordable and efficient way to get around, and you also get to notice more about the city youâ€™re living in,â€ she said.
If you donâ€™t have a bike and youâ€™re 16 or older with a valid driverâ€™s license, donâ€™t let that hold you back from exploring the beauty of the community. With the Free Community Bike Share Program thatâ€™s managed by the Schuylkill River Greenways National Heritage Area, you can borrow a bike to cycle along the Schuylkill River, run an errand, or ride to a historic site â€” free â€” all while getting fit and having fun in the process.
For more information, visit www.bikeschuylkill.org or www.takeitoutdoorsadventures.com
Among several locations where you can pick up bikes is Take it Outdoors, located in Riverfront Park near the Riverfront Rotary pavilion. Open Wednesday to Sunday from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m.

title: Exames apontam lesÃµes de Michael e De la Cruz, e dupla vira mais desfalque no Flamengo | flamengo | ge
text:
Michael, do Flamengo, sente dores na coxa e precisa ser atendido
O Flamengo informou na manhÃ£ desta sexta-feira que os exames de imagem confirmaram as lesÃµes de Michael e De la Cruz no mÃºsculo posterior da coxa direita. O clube nÃ£o informou a gravidade das lesÃµes, mas a dupla virou desfalque para o jogo contra o Corinthians no domingo, Ã s 16h (de BrasÃ­lia) na Neo QuÃ­moca Arena, e tambÃ©m corre risco de ficar fora da partida de volta das quartas de final da Copa do Brasil, diante do Bahia no dia 12 de setembro, apÃ³s a Data Fifa.
Michael e De la Cruz se lesionaram na vitÃ³ria por 1 a 0 sobre o Bahia na Ãºltima quarta-feira, na Casa de Apostas Arena Fonte Nova. O uruguaio, que deu a assistÃªncia para o gol de Bruno Henrique, saiu justamente para a entrada do atacante, que se lesionou nos minutos finais e foi flagrado pelas cÃ¢meras da TV Globo sendo retirado no colo pelo fisioterapeuta Marcio Puglia e pelo preparador fÃ­sico FÃ¡bio Mahseredjian.
De la Cruz sente dores na coxa direita e Ã© substituÃ­do no Flamengo

SÃ£o cinco lesÃµes parecidas num intervalo de duas semanas. Pedro e Gabigol se machucaram no dia 15, contra o BolÃ­var no MaracanÃ£, pela Libertadores - o camisa 9, aliÃ¡s, tem retorno projetado contra o Corinthians, domingo, em SÃ£o Paulo. TrÃªs dias depois, foi a vez de Arrascaeta sair lesionado no clÃ¡ssico contra o Botafogo no Nilton Santos, pelo Campeonato Brasileiro. E na Ãºltima quarta-feira, Michael e De la Cruz tambÃ©m foram parar no departamento mÃ©dico.
LesÃµes musculares em 15 dias:
Pedro: posterior da coxa esquerda Gabigol: posterior da coxa direita Arrascaeta: adutor da coxa esquerda De la Cruz: posterior da coxa direita Michael: posterior da coxa direita
Pedro voltando
Apesar do departamento mÃ©dico cheio (contando ainda Cebolinha e ViÃ±a, que nÃ£o jogam mais esse ano por causa de graves lesÃµes), a boa notÃ­cia Ã© Pedro. O camisa 9 jÃ¡ se recuperou, voltou a treinar com bola esta semana e deve retornar Ã  relaÃ§Ã£o para o jogo de domingo, Ã s 16h (de BrasÃ­lia), contra o Corinthians na Neo QuÃ­mica Arena. O centroavante Ã© o artilheiro do Flamengo em 2024 com 31 gols, sendo 29 em partidas oficiais e mais dois em amistosos.

Pedro, que foi convocado por Dorival JÃºnior mesmo machucado, depois de enfrentar o Corinthians se apresentarÃ¡ Ã  seleÃ§Ã£o brasileira para os jogos contra Equador e Paraguai, pelas eliminatÃ³rias para a Copa do Mundo. Pulgar tambÃ©m foi convocado pelo Chile, jÃ¡ o Uruguai ainda nÃ£o anunciou a sua lista. Mas do quarteto uruguaio do Flamengo , sÃ³ Varela estÃ¡ fora do departamento mÃ©dico.
Entre os outros lesionados, Gabigol jÃ¡ estÃ¡ em fase de transiÃ§Ã£o e comeÃ§ou a fazer trabalhos no campo esta semana, mas ainda de forma separada do grupo. E Arrascaeta continua em tratamento e fisioterapia. O clube tenta preparar a dupla para ficar Ã  disposiÃ§Ã£o de Tite apÃ³s a parada do calendÃ¡rio para a data Fifa, entre os dias 2 e 10 de setembro.

author: Amanda Wernik
title: With new bus route, Santa Maria Transit aims to speed up trip to SLO
text:
With new bus route, Santa Maria Transit aims to speed up trip to SLO
The City of Santa Maria is asking for community feedback on a new bus route to San Luis Obispo.
Santa Maria created a survey to let residents weigh-in on the particulars of the proposed route. The survey asks residents about their ideal pick up and drop off locations and how frequently they travel between the two cities.
City Spokesperson Mark van de Kamp said Santa Maria Regional Transit is adding the bus route to smooth the commute between the two cities.
â€œWe think it will really benefit the community by helping commuters have a reliable and clean service that will also help reduce congestion along the 101,â€ Van de Kamp said.
Van de Kamp said the goal is for the new bus route to be running by next summer.
Greyhound and SLO Regional Transit currently run routes covering the roughly 33-miles between the cities.
State and federal funds are helping to pay for the Santa Maria Transit project, along with money collected from fares.
The deadline to fill out the [online survey](https://www.cityofsantamaria.org/services/departments/department-of-public-works/santa-maria-regional-transit-5008) is Feb. 15.

author: N.S.
title: Cuidado con viajar con equipaje extra: cÃ³mo colocarlo y sanciones por no hacerlo bien
text: Secciones Servicios Destacamos N.S. Viernes, 30 de agosto 2024 Necesitas ser suscriptor para acceder a esta funcionalidad. Opciones para compartir Seguro que te ha pasado. Te vas de vacaciones con una maleta y una mochila, y cuando tienes que volver, casi tienes el doble de cosas para guardar. Pero el problema es a la hora de meterlo en el coche, esos bultos de mÃ¡s pueden suponer algunas complicaciones. Si algo hay que tener claro es que ningÃºn objeto debe ir suelto dentro del vehÃ­culo, es decir, con los pasajeros. Esto quiere decir que no se deben llevar mochilas, bolsas u otros bultos en los asientos traseros. Todo el equipaje debe ir en el maletero y bien sujeto, con una separaciÃ³n fÃ­sica respecto a los ocupantes. SÃ³lo asÃ­ se puede garantizar que nada sale proyectado en caso de frenazo o accidente de trÃ¡fico. Â«Viajar con un simple ordenador portÃ¡til de 2,2 kg puede resultar especialmente peligroso. Su impacto puede ser similar a chocar contra un jabalÃ­ de 85 kg, si el coche frena a una velocidad de 50 km/h. Si la velocidad es de 90 km/h, la situaciÃ³n es todavÃ­a mÃ¡s impactante, ya que se asemeja a colisionar contra un oso pardo de 275 kg, segÃºn avisan desde la DirecciÃ³n General de TrÃ¡fico (DGT). Lamentablemente, no damos la merecida importancia que se merece al simple hecho de colocar el equipaje correctamente ni le dedicamos el tiempo necesarioÂ», afirma Guillermo RodrÃ­guez, Market Manager Transporte y Movilidad de Norauto EspaÃ±a. En este sentido, los bultos mÃ¡s pesados y grandes deben ir en la parte baja y central del maletero, lo mÃ¡s prÃ³ximo al eje. Se aconseja equilibrar el peso por todo el maletero y repartirlo correctamente. Si las maletas llevan ruedas, se aconseja ponerlas hacia arriba para que no rueden por el maletero. Es muy frecuente que los vehÃ­culos SUV o 4x4 ofrezcan conexiÃ³n entre el maletero y la zona de pasajeros. Siempre hay que llevar la bandeja cerrada y se aconseja contar con una separaciÃ³n fÃ­sica como puede ser una rejilla. Por supuesto, desde Norauto se seÃ±ala que es vital que el maletero cierre correctamente. Hay que recordar que la carga no puede caer bajo ningÃºn concepto a la carretera. Puede que el maletero no sea suficiente. En estos casos, es recomendable optar por diferentes soluciones de transporte segÃºn lo que se vaya a llevar. AsÃ­, por ejemplo, se pueden utilizar cofres o maleteros de techo donde colocar ese equipaje extra o los cada vez mÃ¡s empleados cofres de enganche, que cÃ³modamente sujetos a la bola del enganche y bien seÃ±alizados segÃºn la normativa de la placa V20, pueden ser una muy buena soluciÃ³n de transporte adicional, afectando en menor medida a la aerodinÃ¡mica del vehÃ­culo. En todo momento se deben seguir los pasos indicados por el fabricante para su correcta instalaciÃ³n. Igualmente, los objetos colocados dentro del maletero de techo deben repartirse de forma uniforme para equilibrar el peso. En este sentido, la instalaciÃ³n de un enganche en el vehÃ­culo puede ser una soluciÃ³n muy eficaz, ya que no sÃ³lo es muy Ãºtil para el transporte de bicicletas de forma cÃ³moda con el correspondiente portabicicletas, sino tambiÃ©n para la instalaciÃ³n de remolques y los mencionados cofres de enganche. Los objetos alargados y rÃ­gidos pueden ir correctamente sujetos en la baca del coche (barras de techo). Sin embargo, desde Norauto se recuerda que si la carga transportada en la baca excede los lÃ­mites de dimensiones establecidos reglamentariamente, la sanciÃ³n puede ser hasta 500 euros de multa y la retirada de 4 puntos del carnet de conducir. Actualmente, el artÃ­culo 15 del Reglamento General de CirculaciÃ³n (RGC) establece que si la carga es divisible, sÃ³lo puede sobresalir por la parte posterior hasta un 10% de la longitud del vehÃ­culo. Si la carga es indivisible, puede hacerlo hasta un 15% de la longitud del vehÃ­culo. En el caso de querer transportar bicicletas, se puede recurrir a un portabicicletas. Actualmente hay cuatro opciones y siempre se debe escoger aquella mÃ¡s recomendable segÃºn las necesidades individuales y tipo de vehÃ­culo. Por un lado, estÃ¡ el portabicicletas de techo, perfecto para transportar de 1 a 4 bicicletas, debe ir sobre las barras de techo. Por otro lado, el de portÃ³n trasero o de maletero permite el transporte de hasta tres bicis. Se fijan sobre el portÃ³n trasero mediante cinchas. El portabicicletas de enganche o de bola puede ser suspendidos o de plataforma. RÃ¡pidos y fÃ¡ciles de instalar. Por Ãºltimo, los remolques son una buena opciÃ³n cuando hay que transportar un elevado nÃºmero de bicicletas. Algunos remolques permiten llevar hasta siete bicicletas. Si por el contrario el coche no va lleno tambiÃ©n es recomendable tomar ciertas precauciones: abrochar los cinturones de los asientos traseros si no hay pasajeros, por ejemplo, sirve para ofrecer una mayor protecciÃ³n y evitar que los bultos puedan salir proyectados atravesando los asientos. TambiÃ©n se aconseja el uso de redes para fijar la carga. Publicidad Publicidad Te puede interesar Publicidad Publicidad Comentar es una ventaja exclusiva para suscriptores Â¿Ya eres suscriptor? Necesitas ser suscriptor para poder votar. Reporta un error en esta noticia

author: CristÃ³bal Reyes
title: Feds launch raids in Orlando and across Florida in secret DoD probe â€“ Orlando Sentinel
text:
News Crime and Public Safety SUBSCRIBER ONLY Feds launch raids in Orlando and across Florida in secret DoD probe One such search apparently hit an engineering contractor near the University of Central Florida Share this: Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Click to share on X (Opens in new window) Lights on a law enforcement vehicle. By CristÃ³bal Reyes | | Orlando Sentinel PUBLISHED: June 27, 2024 at 5:12 p.m. | UPDATED: June 27, 2024 at 5:13 p.m. Federal investigators searched multiple sites in Florida this week, including Orlando, in what appeared to be a series of raids connected to an unknown criminal investigation.
The searches, which took place Tuesday and confirmed Thursday by the Department of Defenseâ€™s Office of Inspector General, were led by the Defense Criminal Investigative Service and the Department of the Army Criminal Investigation Division, but itâ€™s not clear exactly where the searches took place and why.
Helicopter footage by WFTV-Channel 9 appeared to show a raid taking place at a building on Discovery Drive, near the University of Central Florida. The building houses Cole Engineering Services Inc., a contractor provides modeling and simulation training to the military.
Inspector Generalâ€™s spokesperson Mollie Halpern declined to confirm what sites were searched, and declined to discuss Cole Engineering, citing an ongoing investigation. Itâ€™s not clear whether any arrests were made or if there are pending charges. A U.S. Army spokesperson also declined further comment.
A spokesperson for Cole Engineering did not immediately respond to a message seeking comment.
Share this: Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Click to share on X (Opens in new window)

author: ChemistryViews
title: Renewable Neste REâ„¢ Powers Lotte Chemicalâ€™s Production
text: Neste and Lotte Chemical have joined forces to improve the sustainability of chemicals and plastics by replacing fossil resources with renewable ones. Neste will supply Lotte Chemical with Neste REâ„¢, a raw material made entirely from renewable sources, for the production of a wide range of plastics and chemicals at Lotte Chemicalâ€™s facilities in Korea. These sustainable products can be used in various sectors such as packaging, construction, textiles, and electronics. Fossil feedstocks can be replaced with Neste RE without infrastructure changes. Plastics made from Neste RE are of the same quality as those made from conventional feedstock. According to Neste, the use of renewable Neste RE reduces greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions by more than 85 % when replacing fossil raw materials, and the use of recycled Neste RE reduces GHG emissions by about 40 % when compared to feedstock production from fossil materials and incineration of plastic waste. In December 2023, Neste joined forces with Eppendorf, Hamburg, Germany, to advance the development of laboratory products made from renewable raw materials. Neste refines waste, residues, and other raw materials into renewable fuels and sustainable raw materials for plastics and other materials. The company produces renewable products at its refineries in Finland, the Netherlands, and Singapore with a current annual nameplate capacity of approximately 3.3 million tons. The companyâ€™s goal is to make the Porvoo oil refinery in Finland the most sustainable refinery in Europe by 2030. Neste is committed to achieving carbon-neutral production by 2035 and to reducing the carbon emission intensity of products sold by 50 % by 2040. Neste Oyj , Espoo, Finland Lotte Chemical , South Korea

author: https://www.facebook.com/ruckrugby/?fref=ts
title: Legendary actor Hugh Laurie has gone viral for his tweet about iconic rugby moment - Ruck
text:
On this day in 2015, Japan pulled off one of the most unforgettable upsets in Rugby World Cup history, defeating South Africa 34-32 at the Amex Stadium in Brighton. The victory, sealed by a last-minute try, is regarded as one of the sportâ€™s greatest moments.
Join the RUCKâ€™s WhatsApp community here and get the latest news sent straight to your messages.
Last-Minute Heroics With the clock ticking down, Japanâ€™s Karne Hesketh crossed the line in the dying seconds to secure the historic win. Under the leadership of coach Eddie Jones, Japan ended a 24-year wait for a World Cup victory in spectacular style. Their only previous World Cup win had come in 1991, and their 18-game winless streak was finally broken on the south coast of England.
Japanâ€™s World Cup Breakthrough Before the remarkable 2015 triumph, Japan had struggled in World Cup competitions. Their drought, stretching over two decades, made the victory all the more surprising. The result sent shockwaves through the rugby world, as South Africa, two-time World Cup champions, were one of the tournament favourites.
Hugh Laurieâ€™s Tribute The historic moment wasnâ€™t just celebrated by rugby fans; legendary actor Hugh Laurie also paid tribute to Japanâ€™s courage and daring. Sharing his thoughts on X (formerly Twitter), Laurie expressed his admiration, writing:
â€œIf you donâ€™t speak Rugby, this will be baffling. If you do, you will recognise it as one of the greatest passages of play in the history of the game. Japan, offered repeated chances to tie with South Africa, risk it all in the final minutes. WC 2015.â€
If you donâ€™t speak Rugby, this will be baffling. If you do, you will recognise it as one of the greatest passages of play in the history of the game. Japan, offered repeated chances to tie with South Africa, risk it all in the final minutes. WC 2015 https://t.co/73ruL3ZQRb
â€” Hugh Laurie (@hughlaurie) September 18, 2024 Laurieâ€™s words resonated with many, capturing the essence of Japanâ€™s bold decision to chase victory rather than settle for a draw.
A Moment That Changed Rugby Japanâ€™s win over South Africa remains one of the most iconic moments in Rugby World Cup history, redefining what is possible for underdog teams. The victory not only inspired millions of fans but also changed the perception of Japanese rugby on the global stage.
NIGEL OWENS DREAM XV: Fullback: Israel Folau (Australia) Owens said: â€œFor me, itâ€™s nip and tuck between Halfpenny and Folau, next to nothing to choose between them. Leigh is brilliant because under the high ball and with his kicking at goal under pressure. He may not always break the line when running but puts his body on the line in defence and is a top-notch match-winner.
â€œBut I go for Folau â€“ only just, I should stress â€“ because of his ability to seemingly beat his man every time he gets the ball in his hand. Heâ€™s such an exciting player and like Leigh he is one of the best under the high ball.
â€œItâ€™s a toss of a coin for meâ€¦ and itâ€™s come down in Folauâ€™s favour.â€
Winger: Stuart Hogg (Scotland) Owens said: â€œHow can you fail to be impressed when watching Hogg play. Heâ€™s so exciting as he burst into that line and, of course, was named Six Nations player of the tournament.
â€œI know heâ€™s a full-back for Scotland, but he is so quick and direct he could easily play on the wing. He reminds me a bit of Shane Williams with some of the things he does.
â€œWhen you see who is on the other wing in my team, youâ€™ll see how they would work brilliantly in tandem.â€
Outside-centre: Brian Oâ€™Driscoll (Ireland) Owens said: â€œNot only is he one of the greatest centres in the history of rugby union but heâ€™s a fantastic man off the field as well. Oâ€™Driscoll has been a wonderful ambassador for the sport and a real leader. He always respected referees and set the right example for others to follow.
â€œA legend of the game who conducted himself superbly, on and off the pitch.â€
Inside-centre: Maâ€™a Nonu (New Zealand) Owens said: â€œHeâ€™s another brilliant player and after every game, win or lose, he would come up and give me a hug. Maâ€™a has always found time at after-match functions or at breakfast if weâ€™ve been staying at the same hotel to come over and have a chat.
â€œWhat a player, mind, too. One of the stalwarts of the New Zealand side for so many years.â€
Winger: Shane Williams (Wales) Owens said: â€œWhen people ask me who is the best player I have refereed itâ€™s pretty much an impossible task to pick one because Iâ€™ve been lucky enough to take charge of so many greats.
â€œBut if Iâ€™m pushed, I would pick Shane for what he achieved after coming from football at 17 or 18 years of age.
â€œHe was in the mould of Gerald Davies in how he left defenders gasping for air as he beat them with those dazzling sidesteps. Nobody would fancy defending against a back three of Shane, Hogg and Folau, I can tell you that.â€
CONTINUES ON PAGE TWO

author: Cyrielle Thevenin
title: Consommation. Â« La norme plutÃ´t que l'exception Â» : la vente d'alcool aux mineurs encore trop rÃ©pandue
text:
Consommation Â« La norme plutÃ´t que lâ€™exception Â» : la vente dâ€™alcool aux mineurs encore trop rÃ©pandue
